introduction.casual: Hey there! This is a live demonstration of my interactive portfolio. You're seeing example data that shows how the system can be personalized for different viewers. Feel free to explore!
introduction.technical: This demonstration showcases the portfolio's capability to deliver personalized, configuration-driven content based on a headless JSON architecture.
introduction.formal: Welcome to the demonstration of the Terminal Portfolio system. The content presented here is for illustrative purposes.

side_projects.name: Artisan Coffee Brewing App
side_projects.desc: A mobile app to help users perfect their pour-over coffee technique.

side_projects.name: Smart Home Dashboard
side_projects.desc: A personal project to design a unified interface for various smart home devices.

scenario_a.highlight: Led redesign of flagship SaaS platform
Built consumer mobile app from scratch

stark_industries.summary: Led design for a complex B2B SaaS platform, focusing on data visualization and enterprise workflows.
achievements: Built a design system that accelerated development by 30%

cyberdyne_systems.summary: Joined as an early designer to build a new consumer-facing mobile application from the ground up.
responsibilities: Collaborating with a small, agile team
achievements: Grew user base from 0 to 50,000 MAU
Increased conversion by 60% through simplified onboarding

project_phoenix.title: Project Phoenix - Mobile App Launch
project_phoenix.desc: Launched a consumer mobile application from zero to 50,000 monthly active users.

project_chimera.title: Project Chimera - Enterprise Dashboard Redesign
project_chimera.desc: Complete redesign of a data-heavy enterprise SaaS dashboard to improve usability.

project_phoenix.challenge: The company needed to enter the consumer market but had no existing mobile presence. The challenge was to design, build, and launch a new application from scratch that could find product-market fit in a competitive space.
approach: Conducted market research and user interviews to define the core value proposition.
Developed low-fidelity wireframes and ran rapid usability tests to validate key user flows.
Created a scalable, multi-platform design system for both iOS and Android.
Worked in a tight loop with the development team in an agile environment.
project_phoenix.solution: Designed and shipped a native mobile application with a focus on a frictionless onboarding experience and a delightful core feature set. The app was built with a product-led growth strategy, including a viral referral system.
results: Grew the user base from zero to 50,000 monthly active users within 6 months.
Increased onboarding conversion by 60% after three iterations.
Achieved a 4.7-star rating in the App Store with over 1,000 reviews.
project_phoenix.learnings: Launching a product from scratch requires a relentless focus on solving a single, critical user problem well. Simplicity and speed of iteration are more valuable than a large feature set in the early stages.

project_chimera.challenge: The existing enterprise dashboard was powerful but incredibly complex. Users were overwhelmed by data, leading to high error rates and long training times for new employees. The goal was to redesign the interface to be intuitive without sacrificing functionality.
approach: Audited the existing platform and conducted contextual inquiries with power users.
Created user personas for different roles (analyst, manager, admin) to understand their unique needs.
Designed a new information architecture based on a modular, widget-based system.
Built a comprehensive, interactive prototype in Figma to test with users and stakeholders.
project_chimera.solution: Delivered a complete redesign of the dashboard, focusing on progressive disclosure. The new interface provided a high-level overview by default, with powerful filtering and deep-dive capabilities available on demand. We introduced customizable layouts and role-based views.
results: Increased user task completion rates by 40%.
Reduced onboarding time for new users by 25%.
Received a 90% user satisfaction score in a post-launch survey.
The new design system accelerated the development of new features by 30%.
project_chimera.learnings: Complexity for enterprise users can be managed by giving them control. A flexible, customizable interface that adapts to a user's specific workflow is more effective than a one-size-fits-all solution.

Design Systems.description: Building comprehensive design systems from the ground up, focusing on scalability, developer handoff, and brand consistency.
examples: Created a token-based system with Figma variables and automated JSON export.
Built a component library with over 150 production-ready components.
Wrote extensive documentation and usage guidelines for developers and designers.

User Research.description: Employing a mixed-methods approach to uncover deep user insights and validate design decisions with data.
examples: Conducted 50+ semi-structured user interviews for a major platform redesign.
Designed and analyzed A/B tests that resulted in a 60% conversion lift.
Used session recording and heatmap analysis to identify critical friction points.
impact: Identified insights that led to a 150% reduction in negative user feedback
Validated designs that increased user satisfaction scores by 90%
